title: Definitions
context: ยง432:1-406 Definitions. As used in this article: &ldquo;Health care expenditures&rdquo; means claims incurred. &ldquo;Managed hospital payment basis&rdquo; means agreements wherein the financial risk is primarily related to the degree of utilization rather than to the cost of services. &ldquo;Member&rdquo; means an individual who is covered by a mutual benefit society. &ldquo;Net worth&rdquo; means the excess of total admitted assets over total liabilities, but the liabilities shall not include fully subordinated debt. &ldquo;Operating expenses&rdquo; means claims adjustment, administrative, soliciting, and reinsurance allowances. &ldquo;Society&rdquo; means mutual benefit society. &ldquo;Uncovered expenditures&rdquo; means the costs to the mutual benefit society for health care services that are the obligation of the mutual benefit society, for which a member may be liable in the event of the mutual benefit society&rsquo;s insolvency, and for which no alternative arrangements have been made that are acceptable to the commissioner. Uncovered expenditures include but are not limited to out-of-area services, referral services, and hospital services. Uncovered expenditures do not include expenditures for services when a provider has agreed not to bill the member even though the provider is not paid by the mutual benefit society, or for services that are guaranteed, insured, or assumed by a person or organization other than a mutual benefit society. [L 1997, c 367, pt of ยง1; am L 2014, c 186, ยง13]
